meanings.definition: The study or use of thermionic phenomena.
meanings.sent1: In thermionics, scientists investigate how heat affects electron emission.
meanings.sent2: Thermionics is an important field of research in physics and engineering.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for thermionics made even the most boring lectures interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a realm of thermionics, where ideas sparked and electrons flowed freely.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on thermionics was so engaging that I couldn't put it down.

meanings.definition: The emission of electrons from a heated cathode.
meanings.sent1: Thermionics involves the release of electrons when a cathode is heated.
meanings.sent2: The thermionics process is used in vacuum tubes and electron guns.
meanings.sent3: The toaster seemed to have mastered thermionics, toasting bread perfectly every time.
meanings.sent4: The thermionics of the old radio brought warmth to the room as music filled the air.
meanings.sent5: As the cathode heated up, the thermionics created a stream of electrons ready for use.
